alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:32PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern El Dorado, east central Placer and northeastern Amador Counties through 530 PM PDT... At 432 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Big Bend Summit to Shriner Lake Campground. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... US Highway 50, Big Bend Summit, Twin Bridges, Fresh Pond, Riverton, Pacific House, Kyburz, Kit Carson, White Hall, Shriner Lake Campground and Pollock Pines. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
